item.description:
No, it's not a Duran Duran concert, but it IS an hour-long lunchtime concert (you can leave early if you need to) by NHCer Alexis & violinist Mark Rike. Satisfy your hunger while listening to music from TWO wolves...Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart and Erich Wolfgang Korngold (& more), as part of the free "Bach's Lunch" series at New Haven's Neighborhood Music School.

Be there by noon, music starts promptly at 12:10 (don't be late!). Be sure your cell phone is off (vibrate-only isn't good enough). If you can't stay until the end just be sure to leave in a break between music when others have started applauding.

It's ok to eat at the concert but please keep it quiet. Crinkly bags/wrappers and big celery stalks wouldn't be great choices.

HOST: Alexis, cell 203-747-9203. However, she won't be answering her phone starting an hour before the concert, and obviously not during it.

POST-PARTY: After the performance feel free to say "hi" and simper & fawn over them. There will definitely be a post-party...TBD, but it is 100% certain that Mark and Alexis will most definitely want to eat and drink after the concert (they are fond of Anna Liffey's), people are welcome to join.

You can hear Alexis playing some Mozart at her site:
www.myspace.com/alexiszingalepianist

PARKING: Don't expect to find parking on Audubon St. (which is a 1-way street). Grove & Whitney have street parking, and there are parking garages in the area (such as on Grove, & on Audubon).
item.name: Fri 10/26-Are you hungry? Like a Wolf?
